personalInfo.clubAffl: Highland CC (Attleboro, Massachusetts); Orange Tree CC (Orlando, Florida)

tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Finished 11-45 at 2015 Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament (exempt to second reshuffle)
tourBios.otherVics: (4): 2009 Maine Open. 2010 Massachusetts Open, Vermont Open, Rhode Island Open.
tourBios.curYearHigh: Made the cut in just seven of 27 starts during his third full season on the PGA TOUR. Finished the season No. 210 in the FedExCup standings, with a T41 at the John Deere Classic his best outing.
tourBios.carHigh:
2013-14: Made 18 of 25 PGA TOUR cuts, with just one top-10. Finished No. 147 in the FedExCup standings to miss the Playoffs. However, was able to finish No. 118 on the money list to retain PGA TOUR card for 2014-15...Made his first cut of the season in his fifth start, finishing a career-best T2 at the AT&T Pebble Beach National Pro-Am for his third career top-10 performance. Did not play on TOUR in 2012 or 2013. His last made cut on PGA TOUR was at the 2011 Children's Miracle Network Classic. Missed the cut in his only previous start in the AT&T Pebble Beach National Pro-Am (2011).

2013: Finished the Web.com Tour campaign with four top-10s, which included a runner-up, and 12 cuts made in 23 events...Had a career-best runner-up finish at the Colombia Championship. Was part of a four-way tie for the lead after 36 holes and shared the 54-hole lead with eventual winner, Patrick Cantlay. Battled Cantlay for the lead during the opening nine Sunday but fell three off the lead after a bogey at No. 12. Would get no closer as he failed to make a birdie the rest of the way. Finished four shots back of Cantlay...Finished T4 at the Chitimacha Louisiana Open, four strokes behind winner Edward Loar. Moved into contention with a 7-under 64 in the third round at Le Triomphe CC. Finished the week T5 in Putting. Payday pushed him over the $100,000 mark and moved him to No. 5 on the money list after only four events...Fired 68-68 in the first two rounds of the Mexico Championship and earned his third top 10 of the year, a T9...Next top-10 was also a T9, coming at the United Leasing Championship...Finished the Regular Season 17th in earnings to secure his 2013-14 PGA TOUR card. 

2012: Made the cut in nine of 24 starts and had three top-10 finishes...Was T9 at the Soboba Golf Classic early in the year...Finished T3 at The Rex Hospital Open after an even-par 71 in the final round. Opened with an 8-under 63 to take a two-stroke lead after the first day. Ended the week at 12-under 272, one shot shy of joining a playoff. His T3 finish was a career-best and moved him up 20 spots, to No. 27 on the money list...Added a T10 at the Albertsons Boise Open, posting four sub-70 scores and finishing a season-best 15-under par...Ended the year ranked No. 2 in Third-Round Scoring Average. 

2011: PGA TOUR rookie made 22 starts, netting a pair of top-10 finishes, both within a four-week summer stretch. His first career top-10 came with a T4 finish at the Viking Classic. Had missed five of his last six cuts going into the Mississippi event. Posted a personal-best 62 in the third round at Annandale GC...Shot an opening-round 63 at the Travelers Championship, but missed the cut after shooting a 74 in the second round...Earned second top-10 of the season, with a solo fifth at the Reno-Tahoe Open. 

2010: Won the NGA Hooters Tour's Sunset Hills NGA Classic. 

2009: Won the Maine Open and finished third on the Golfer's Warehouse Tour money list. 

2008: Missed the cut at the Transitions Championship in his first career PGA TOUR start...Dominated in New England, winning the Massachusetts Open, Vermont Open and Rhode Island Open.

2007: First Web.com Tour start was a missed cut at the Northeast Pennsylvania Classic.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Was a 2005 and 2006 NAIA first-team All-American. 2005 NAIA Player of the Year and individual national champion. Attended Bishop Feehan High School in Attleboro, Mass. Was a two-time Boston Globe Player of the Year. Won the team and individual 2002 state championship. Winner of the 2001 Massachusetts Amateur Championship.
tourBios.personal: Sister, Libby, is a swimmer at Roger Williams University...Cites winning the 2001 Massachusetts Amateur Championship as his biggest thrill in golf. Favorite golf course played is Oakmont. Would most like to play Pebble Beach. Never travels without his headphones. Favorite college team is the University of Oklahoma. Favorite professional team is the New England Patriots. Favorite TV show is "Seinfeld." Favorite movie is "Jaws." Lists filet and sushi as his favorite foods. Favorite athlete is Tom Brady. Would round out his dream foursome with his dad, Tom Brady and Adam Sandler.

tourBios.otherVics: (4): 2008 Massachusetts Open, Vermont Open, Rhode Island Open. 2009 Maine Open.

Amateur: Was a 2005 and 2006 NAIA first-team All-American. 2005 NAIA Player of the Year and individual national champion. Attended Bishop Feehan High School in Attleboro, Mass. Was a two-time Boston Globe Player of the Year. Won the team and individual 2002 state championship. Winner of the 2001 Massachusetts Amateur Championship.
tourBios.personal: Sister, Libby, was a swimmer at Roger Williams University...Cites finishing runner-up as a 17-year-old at the 2001 Massachusetts Amateur Championship as his biggest thrill in golf. Favorite golf course played is Oakmont. Never travels without his headphones. Favorite college team is the University of Oklahoma. Favorite professional team is the New England Patriots. Favorite TV show is "Seinfeld," and his top movie is "Jaws." Lists filet and sushi as his favorite foods. Favorite athlete is Tom Brady. Would round out his dream foursome with his dad, Brady and Adam Sandler.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR was T2nd in 2014 at the AT&T Pebble Beach National Pro-Am.
